Atari SIO Pocket Modem - Internals

 

The Pocket Modem was released in 1984 by BOT Engineering and plugged directly into a free SIO port on any device in the SIO daisy chain.   If you choose to directly plug it into the side of the Atari 400 or 800 computers you would need to use the Cartridge to boot up and access the modem. 

Otherwise for more sophisticated use such as running the terminal program with disk access for sending and receiving files or to run a BBS (Bulletin Board System) you would need to place it at the end of the daisy chain with 1 or more disk drives attached so you could boot up the driver and program diskette.

The modem ran at 300 Baud, but also had a special 450 Baud mode if you dialed up and connected to another Pocket Modem.

***Special Thanks to Ron Leblanc for providing the

museum with a personal copy of his Pocket Modem Manual.
